grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 添乗【テンジョウ】accompanying (on a trip), escorting (a tour group)
別添【ベッテン】attachment, annexation, addendum, appendix
kun reading compounds: 添える【そえる】to garnish, to accompany (as a card does a gift), to add to as support, to prop up, to accompany (as an aid, guide, translator, etc.), to mimic, to imitate, to draw something near to oneself, to approach nearby

添う【そう】to meet (wishes, expectations, etc.), to satisfy, to comply with, to live up to, to accompany, to go with, to stay by one's side, to associate with (someone), to mix with, to marry, to wed, to be added
添水【そうず】water-filled bamboo tube in Japanese garden which clacks against a stone when emptied
